analyzed: kacci bhikkhave khamanīya kacci yāpanīya
translated: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re getting by.

original: kaccittha appakilamathena addhānaṁ āgatā;
analyzed: kaccittha appa kilamathena addhānam āgatā
translated: I hope you’ve come along the road with only a little weariness.

original: kuto ca tumhe, bhikkhave, āgacchathā”ti?
analyzed: kutas ca tumhe bhikkhave āgacchatha ati
translated: And where have you come from?”

original: “Khamanīyaṁ, bhagavā, yāpanīyaṁ, bhagavā.
analyzed: khamanīya bhagavā yāpanīya bhagavā
translated: “We’re keeping well, Sir, we’re getting by.

original: Idha mayaṁ, bhante, kāsīsu vassaṁvuṭṭhā rājagahaṁ āgacchantā bhagavantaṁ dassanāya antarāmagge na labhimhā lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadatthaṁ pāripūriṁ;
analyzed: idha bhante kāsīsu vassavuṭṭhāḥ rājagaham āgacchantāḥ bhagavantam dassanāya antarāmagge na labhimhā lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāvadattham pāripūri
translated: While we were returning from the rainy season in Kāsī to see the Buddha, we didn’t get enough coarse or fine food along the way.

original: bahuñca phalakhādanīyaṁ ahosi;
analyzed: bahun ca phala khādanīyam
translated: There was a lot of fruit to eat,

original: kappiyakārako ca na ahosi;
analyzed: kappiya kārako ca na ahosi
translated: but there was no one to make it allowable.

original: tena mayaṁ kilantarūpā addhānaṁ āgatā”ti.
analyzed: tena mayam kilanta rūpāḥ addhānam āgatā ati
translated: That’s why we’re exhausted.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks,

original: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yattha phalakhādanīyaṁ passati, kappiyakārako ca na hoti, sāmaṁ gahetvā, haritvā, kappiyakārake passitvā, bhūmiyaṁ nikkhipitvā, paṭiggahāpetvā paribhuñjituṁ.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave yattha phala khādanīyam passati kappiya kārako ca na hoti sāmam gahetvā haritvā kappiya kārake passitvā bhūmiyam nikkhipitvā paṭiggahāpetvā paribhuñjitu
translated: “Monks, if you see fruit to eat, but there’s no one to make it allowable, then take it yourself, carry it away, and when you see someone who is allowable, put it on the ground, have it received, and then eat it.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, uggahitaṁ paṭiggahitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave uggahitam paṭiggahitun ti
translated: I allow you to receive what has been picked.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa navā ca tilā navañca madhu uppannā honti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa navā ca tilāḥ navañca madhu uppannāḥ honti
translated: On one occasion a certain brahmin had newly harvested sesame seeds and honey.

original: Atha kho tassa brāhmaṇassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho tassa brāhmaṇassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ nave ca tile navañca madhuṁ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dadeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham nave ca tile navam ca madhum buddha ppamukhassa bhikkhu saṅghassa dadeyyanti
translated: “Why don’t I give the newly harvested sesame seeds and honey to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha?”

original: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ paṭisammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim paṭisammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: He then went up to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him, and stood to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam ṭhitaḥ kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He said to the Buddha,

original: “adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ, saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhatta saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: “Would Master Gotama and the Sangha of monks please accept tomorrow’s meal from me?”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena  atha khalu saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā pakkāmi
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.🔽The brahmin then left.

original: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālam ārocāpesi
translated: The following morning that brahmin had various kinds of fine food prepared. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: “kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “It’s time, Master Gotama. The meal is ready.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena tassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena tassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: Then, when it was morning, the Buddha robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, went to that brahmin’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim ekamantam nisīdi
translated: The brahmin personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, the brahmin sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā, samādapetvā, samuttejetvā, sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho tam brāhmaṇam bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching, after which he got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho tassa brāhmaṇassa acirapakkantassa bhagavato etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho tassa brāhmaṇassa acira pakkantassa bhagavataḥ etat ahosi
translated: Soon after the Buddha left, the brahmin thought,

original: “yesaṁ kho mayā atthāya buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito, ‘nave ca tile navañca madhuṁ dassāmī’ti, te mayā pamuṭṭhā dātuṁ.
analyzed: yesam kho mayā atthāya buddha ppamukhaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ nimantitaḥ nave ca tile navam ca madhum dassāmi iti te mayā pamuṭṭhāḥ dātu
translated: “I invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for the sake of giving new sesame seeds and fresh honey, but I forgot to give them.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ nave ca tile navañca madhuṁ kolambehi ca ghaṭehi ca ārāmaṁ harāpeyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham nave ca tile navam ca madhum kolambehi ca ghaṭehi ca ārāmam
translated: Why don’t I have new sesame seeds and new honey brought in pots and baskets?”

original: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo nave ca tile navañca madhuṁ kolambehi ca ghaṭehi ca ārāmaṁ harāpetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ nave ca tile navam ca madhum kolambehi ca ghaṭehi ca ārāmam yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: He then had new sesame seeds and new honey brought in pots and baskets. He then went to the Buddha and stood to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam ṭhitaḥ kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He said to the Buddha,

original: “yesaṁ kho mayā, bho gotama, atthāya buddhappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho nimantito, ‘nave ca tile navañca madhuṁ dassāmī’ti, te mayā pamuṭṭhā dātuṁ.
analyzed: yesam kho mayā bho gotama atthāya buddha ppamukhaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ nimantitaḥ nave ca tile navam ca madhum dassāmi iti te mayā pamuṭṭhāḥ dātu
translated: “Master Gotama, I invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha to give new sesame seeds and new honey, but I forgot to give them.

original: Paṭiggaṇhātu me bhavaṁ gotamo nave ca tile navañca madhun”ti.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhātu me bhavam gotamaḥ nave ca tile navañca madhunti
translated: Please accept them.”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhūnaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa bhikkhūnam dehi iti
translated: “Well then, brahmin, give them to the monks.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dubbhikkhe appamattakepi pavārenti, paṭisaṅkhāpi paṭikkhipanti,
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dubbhikkhe appamattake api pavārenti paṭisaṅkhā api paṭikkhipanti
translated: At that time the monks were reluctant to accept much almsfood, even if it was little.

original: sabbo ca saṅgho pavārito hoti. Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti.
analyzed: sabbaḥ ca saṅghaḥ pavāritaḥ hoti bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti
translated: and the whole Sangha had been invited. But the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.

original: “Paṭiggaṇhatha, bhikkhave, paribhuñjatha.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhatha bhikkhave paribhuñjatha
translated: “Accept it, monks, and eat it.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tato nīhaṭaṁ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṁ paribhuñjitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave tatas nīhaṭam bhuttāvinā pavāritena an atirittam paribhuñjitum ti
translated: I allow you to eat what has been picked up if you have finished your meal and have been invited again, and it is not leftover.”

original: 7. Paṭiggahitādianujānana
analyzed: paṭiggahita ādi anujānana
translated: 1.1 The allowance for what has been received, etc.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upanandassa sakyaputtassa upaṭṭhākakulaṁ saṅghassatthāya khādanīyaṁ pāhesi—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ upanandassa sakya puttassa upaṭṭhāka kulam saṅghassa atthāya khādanīyam pāhesi
translated: On one occasion a family that was supporting Venerable Upananda the Sakyan sent some fresh food to the Sangha,

original: “ayyassa upanandassa dassetvā saṅghassa dātabban”ti.
analyzed: ayyassa upanandassa dassetvā saṅghassa dātabbanti
translated: saying, “Please give this to Upananda and then to the Sangha.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto gāmaṁ piṇḍāya paviṭṭho hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto gāmam piṇḍāya paviṭṭhaḥ hoti
translated: On that occasion Upananda had gone to the village for alms.

original: Atha kho te manussā ārāmaṁ gantvā bhikkhū pucchiṁsu—
analyzed: atha kho te manussāḥ ārāmam gantvā bhikkhū pucchisu
translated: When those people arrived at the monastery, they asked the monks,

original: “kahaṁ, bhante, ayyo upanando”ti?🔽“Esāvuso, āyasmā upanando sakyaputto gāmaṁ piṇḍāya paviṭṭho”ti.
analyzed: kaha bhante ayyo upanando ti  esa āvuso āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto gāmam piṇḍāya paviṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: “Where’s Upananda?”🔽“He’s gone to the village for alms.”

original: “Idaṁ, bhante, khādanīyaṁ ayyassa upanandassa dassetvā saṅghassa dātabban”ti.
analyzed: idam bhante khādanīyam ayyassa upanandassa dassetvā saṅghassa dātabbanti
translated: “We sent this fresh food for Upananda to give to the Sangha.”

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, paṭiggahetvā nikkhipatha yāva upanando āgacchatī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave paṭiggahetvā nikkhipatha yāva upanandaḥ āgacchati iti
translated: “Well then, monks, receive it and put it aside until Upananda returns.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā upanando sakyaputto purebhattaṁ kulāni payirupāsitvā divā āgacchati.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai upanandaḥ sakya putto purebhattam kulāni payirupāsitvā divā āgacchati
translated: But Upananda Sakyaputta went to families for alms before the meal and returned during the day.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dubbhikkhe appamattakepi pavārenti, paṭisaṅkhāpi paṭikkhipanti, sabbo ca saṅgho pavārito hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dubbhikkhe appamattake api pavārenti paṭisaṅkhā api paṭikkhipanti sabbaḥ ca saṅghaḥ pavāritaḥ hoti
translated: On that occasion, because of the famine, the monks only accepted a little, they refused additional food, and the whole Sangha was invited.

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti
translated: But being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks didn’t receive the food.

original: “Paṭiggaṇhatha, bhikkhave, paribhuñjatha.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhatha bhikkhave paribhuñjatha
translated: “Receive it, monks, and eat it.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, purebhattaṁ paṭiggahitaṁ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṁ paribhuñjitun”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave purebhattam paṭiggahitam bhuttāvinā pavāritena an atirittam paribhuñjitun ti  atha khalu bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantam viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikam pakkāmi
translated: I allow you to eat what has been received before the meal from a family that has been invited, if it is not excessive.”🔽When the Buddha had stayed at Rājagaha for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

original: Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.
analyzed: anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena sāvatthi tat avasari
translated: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: There the Blessed One lived in Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa kāyaḍāhābādho hoti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa kāya ḍāha ābādhaḥ hoti  atha khalu āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ yena āyasmā sāriputtaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: On that occasion Ven. Sāriputta was afflicted, suffering, and very sick.

original: “pubbe te, āvuso sāriputta, kāyaḍāhābādho kena phāsu hotī”ti?
analyzed: pubbe te āvuso sāriputta kāya ḍāha ābādho kena phāsu hoti iti
translated: Then Ven. Mahā Moggallāna went to Ven. Sāriputta and, on arrival, said to him, “Friend Sāriputta, what is your affliction like now?”

original: “Bhisehi ca me, āvuso, muḷālikāhi cā”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ🔽pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva jetavane antarahito mandākiniyā
analyzed: bhisehi ca me āvusaḥ muḷālikāhi ca ati  atha kho āyasmai mahāmoggallāno seyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāha  pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva jetavane antarahitaḥ mandākiniyā
translated: “My affliction is such that I would be comfortable with some fresh ginger and black mustard seeds.”

original: pokkharaṇiyā tīre pāturahosi.
analyzed: pokkharaṇiyā tīre
translated: Then Ven. Mahā Moggallāna—just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm—disappeared from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared on the bank of the Mandākini River.

original: Addasā kho aññataro nāgo āyasmantaṁ mahāmoggallānaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ, disvāna āyasmantaṁ mahāmoggallānaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: addasā kho aññataraḥ nāgaḥ āyasmantam mahāmoggallānam dūratas uva āgacchanta disvānaḥ āyasmantam mahāmoggallānam etat avoca
translated: He saw a certain nāga and, on seeing him, said to him,🔽“

original: “etu kho, bhante, ayyo mahāmoggallāno. Svāgataṁ, bhante, ayyassa mahāmoggallānassa.
analyzed: etu kho bhante ayyaḥ mahāmoggallāno svāgata bhante ayyassa mahāmoggallānassa
translated: “Please come, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna. Welcome, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna.

original: Kena, bhante, ayyassa attho;
analyzed: kena bhante ayyassa attho
translated: What do you need, Venerable?

original: kiṁ dammī”ti?
analyzed: kim dammi iti
translated: What can I give you?”

original: “Bhisehi ca me, āvuso, attho, muḷālikāhi cā”ti.
analyzed: bhisehi ca me āvuso atthaḥ muḷālikāhi ca ati
translated: “I need some fruits and some lily tubers.”

original: Atha kho so nāgo aññataraṁ nāgaṁ āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha kho so nāgaḥ aññataram nāgam āṇāpesi
translated: The dragon then told another dragon,

original: “tena hi, bhaṇe, ayyassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca yāvadatthaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhaṇe ayyassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca yāvadattham dehi iti
translated: “Please give the Venerable as many fruits and lily tubers as he needs.”

original: Atha kho so nāgo mandākiniṁ pokkharaṇiṁ ogāhetvā, soṇḍāya bhisañca muḷālikañca abbāhitvā, suvikkhālitaṁ vikkhāletvā, bhaṇḍikaṁ bandhitvā yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ nāgaḥ mandākinim pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā soṇḍāya bhisam ca muḷālikam ca abbāhitvā su vikkhālitam vikkhāletvā bhaṇḍikam bandhitvā yena ayasmai mahāmoggallānaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: That dragon then went to the lake Mandākinī, pulled out some fruits and lily tubers with his trunk, washed them well, tied them in a bundle, and went to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna.

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai mahāmoggallāna useyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāha
translated: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm

original: pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—mandākiniyā pokkharaṇiyā tīre antarahito
analyzed: pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva mandākiniyā pokkharaṇiyā tīre antarahitaḥ
translated: or flex his extended arm, disappeared from the bank of the lake Mandākinī

original: jetavane pāturahosi.
analyzed: jetavane
translated: and reappeared in Jeta’s Grove.

original: Sopi kho nāgo mandākiniyā pokkharaṇiyā tīre antarahito jetavane pāturahosi.
analyzed: saḥ api kho nāgaḥ mandākiniyā pokkharaṇiyā tīre antarahitaḥ jetavane pātuḥ ahosi
translated: The nāga disappeared from the Mandākinī lotus pond and reappeared in Jeta’s Grove.

original: Atha kho so nāgo āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca paṭiggahāpetvā jetavane antarahito mandākiniyā pokkharaṇiyā tīre pāturahosi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ nāgaḥ āyasmataḥ mahāmoggallānassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca paṭiggahāpetvā jetavane antarahitaḥ mandākiniyā pokkharaṇiyā tīre pāturahosi
translated: The nāga then had Moggallāna accept the rice and the curry, disappeared from Jeta’s Grove, and reappeared at the Mandākinī lotus pond.

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āyasmato sāriputtassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca upanāmesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca upanāmesi
translated: Moggallāna then gave the rice and the curry to Sāriputta.

original: Atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca bhuttassa kāyaḍāhābādho paṭippassambhi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa bhise ca muḷālikāyo ca bhuttassa kāya ḍāha ābādho paṭippassambhi
translated: After eating the rice and the curry, Sāriputta’s dysentery was cured.

original: Bahū bhisā ca muḷālikāyo ca avasiṭṭhā honti.
analyzed: bahū bhisā ca muḷālikāyo ca avasiṭṭhā honti
translated: There was a large amount of rice and curry left over.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dubbhikkhe appamattakepi pavārenti, paṭisaṅkhāpi paṭikkhipanti, sabbo ca saṅgho pavārito hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dubbhikkhe appamattake api pavārenti paṭisaṅkhā api paṭikkhipanti sabbaḥ ca saṅghaḥ pavāritaḥ hoti
translated: At that time, because of the famine, the monks only accepted a little, even when offered a lot. They refused what was left over, even when asked to accept it. And the whole Sangha was invited.

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti
translated: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not accept the food that was left over.

original: “Paṭiggaṇhatha, bhikkhave, paribhuñjatha.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhatha bhikkhave paribhuñjatha
translated: “Accept it, monks, and eat it.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, vanaṭṭhaṁ pokkharaṭṭhaṁ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṁ paribhuñjitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave vanaṭṭham pokkharaṭṭham bhuttāvinā pavāritena an atirittam paribhuñjitun ti
translated: “Monks, I allow you to eat forest-grown lotus roots that have been cut off at the root, if you haven’t consented to a meal and it hasn’t been prepared for your specific consumption.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṁ bahuṁ phalakhādanīyaṁ uppannaṁ hoti, kappiyakārako ca na hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyam bahum phala khādanīyam uppannam hoti kappiya kārako ca na hoti
translated: On one occasion at Sāvatthī much fruit had been offered, but there was no one to prepare it.

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā phalaṁ na paribhuñjanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā phalam na paribhuñjanti
translated: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not eat the fruit.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, abījaṁ nibbattabījaṁ akatakappaṁ phalaṁ paribhuñjitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave abījam nibbatta bījam a kata kappam phalam paribhuñjitun ti
translated: “Monks, I allow you to eat fruit that is seedless, that has had its seeds removed, and that hasn’t been prepared for your specific consumption.”

original: 8. Satthakammapaṭikkhepakathā🔽Atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena rājagahaṁ tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.🔽Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena rājagahaṁ tadavasari.
analyzed: sattha kamma paṭikkhepa kathā  atha khalu bhagavā sāvatthiyam yathābhirantam viharitvā yena rājagaham tena cārikam pakkāmi  anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena rājagaham tat avasari
translated: The account of the prohibition against surgery🔽When the Buddha had stayed at Sāvatthī for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Rājagaha.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno bhagandalābādho hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno bhagandala ābādhaḥ hoti
translated: On one occasion a certain monk had hemorrhoids.

original: Ākāsagotto vejjo satthakammaṁ karoti.
analyzed: ākāsa gottaḥ vejjaḥ sattha kammam karoti
translated: A doctor named Ākāso performed surgery on him.

original: Atha kho bhagavā senāsanacārikaṁ āhiṇḍanto yena tassa bhikkhuno vihāro tenupasaṅkami.🔽Addasā kho ākāsagotto vejjo bhagavantaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ, disvāna bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā senāsana cārikam āhiṇḍantaḥ yena tassa bhikkhuno vihāraḥ tena upasaṅkami  addasā kho ākāsa gottaḥ vejjaḥ bhagavantam dūratas vai āgacchanta disvāna bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: As he was walking about the dwellings, he came to the dwelling of that monk.

original: “āgacchatu bhavaṁ gotamo, imassa bhikkhuno vaccamaggaṁ passatu, seyyathāpi godhāmukhan”ti.
analyzed: āgacchatu bhavam gotamaḥ imassa bhikkhuno vacca maggam passatu seyyathā api godhā mukham ti
translated: The brahmin Ākāsa saw the Buddha coming and said to him, “Come, Gotama. Look at this monk’s anus. It’s like the mouth of a cow.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā—
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān
translated: The Buddha thought,

original: “so maṁ khvāyaṁ moghapuriso uppaṇḍetī”ti—
analyzed: saḥ mama khvā ayam mogha purisaḥ uppaṇḍeti iti
translated: “This foolish man is mocking me,”

original: tatova paṭinivattitvā, etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā, bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
analyzed: tatas va paṭinivattitvā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi
translated: and he returned right away. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

original: “atthi kira, bhikkhave, amukasmiṁ vihāre bhikkhu gilāno”ti?
analyzed: atthi kira bhikkhave amukasmin vihāre bhikkhu gilānaḥ ti
translated: “Is there a sick monk in such-and-such a dwelling?”

original: “Atthi, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: atthi bhagavā ati
translated: “There is, Sir.”

original: “Kiṁ tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ābādho”ti?
analyzed: kim tassa bhikkhave bhikkhuno ābādhaḥ ti
translated: “What’s his illness?”

original: “Tassa, bhante, āyasmato bhagandalābādho, ākāsagotto vejjo satthakammaṁ karotī”ti.
analyzed: tassa bhante āyasmataḥ bhagandalābādhaḥ ākāsa gottaḥ vejjaḥ sattha kammam karoti iti
translated: “Sir, that monk has hemorrhoids, and the brahmin Ākāsa is performing surgery on him.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā—
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Buddha rebuked him,🔽“Foolish man, how can you do this?

original: “ananucchavikaṁ, bhikkhave, tassa moghapurisassa, ananulomikaṁ, appatirūpaṁ, assāmaṇakaṁ, akappiyaṁ, akaraṇīyaṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave tassa moghapurisassa ananulomika appatirūpa a sāmaṇaka a kappiya a karaṇīya
translated: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

original: Kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso sambādhe satthakammaṁ kārāpessati.
analyzed: katham hi nāma saḥ bhikkhave mogha purisaḥ sambādhe sattha kammam kārāpessati
translated: How can that foolish man have a procedure of branding done in a private place?

original: Sambādhe, bhikkhave, sukhumā chavi, duropayo vaṇo, dupparihāraṁ satthaṁ.🔽Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: sambādhe bhikkhave sukhumā chavi vaṇaḥ dupparihāram  na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: The skin in a private place is delicate and the wound is hard to heal. A knife is hard to control.🔽Monks, this rule should be observed for the following reasons: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the monks, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives, for the restraint of the ten courses of action, and for the purity of the monastic community.

original: vigarahitvā …pe…
analyzed: vigara hitvā pe
translated: After rebuking him in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

original: dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: and then said to the monks:

original: “na, bhikkhave, sambādhe satthakammaṁ kārāpetabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave sambādhe sattha kammam kārāpetabba
translated: “You should not have a procedure of branding done in a private place.

original: Yo kārāpeyya, āpatti thullaccayassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ kārāpeyye āpatti thullaccayassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit a serious offense.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū
translated: On one occasion the monks from the group of six

original: “bhagavatā satthakammaṁ paṭikkhittan”ti—
analyzed: bhagavatā sattha kammam paṭikkhittanti
translated: “The Buddha has prohibited branding,”

original: vatthikammaṁ kārāpenti.
analyzed: vatthi kammam kārāpenti
translated: had a procedure of cauterization done.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā, te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vatthikammaṁ kārāpessantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū vatthi kammam kārāpessanti iti
translated: “How can the monks from the group of six have a procedure of cauterization done?” …

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: The monks told the Buddha.

original: “Saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vatthikammaṁ kārāpentī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū vatthi kammam kārāpenti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six are having these things made?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti …pe…
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati pe
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: vigarahitvā dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: vigarahitvā dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: After rebuking them …

original: “na, bhikkhave, sambādhassa sāmantā dvaṅgulā satthakammaṁ vā vatthikammaṁ vā kārāpetabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave sambādhassa sāmantā dvaṅgulā sattha kammam vā vatthi kammam vā kārāpetabba
translated: “You should not have a needle case or a carrying net made within two handspans of the edge of a robe.

original: Yo kārāpeyya, āpatti thullaccayassā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ kārāpeyye āpatti thullaccayassa ati
translated: If you do, you commit an offense entailing suspension.”

original: 9. Manussamaṁsapaṭikkhepakathā
translated: The account of the prohibition against human flesh

original: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena bārāṇasī tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.

translated: “For those who are restrained, who eat what others give,🔽who give rice porridge in a timely way and respectfully,

original: Dasassa ṭhānāni anuppavecchati,
analyzed: dasassa ṭhānāni anuppavecchati
translated: it leads to ten things:🔽long life, beauty, happiness, strength,

original: Bhesajjametaṁ sugatena vaṇṇitaṁ.

analyzed: dibbāni vā patthayatā sukhāni

original: Manussasobhagyatamicchatā vā”ti.
analyzed: vāti
translated: or for human good fortune.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā tam brāhmaṇam imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
