analyzed: katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya  kiriya vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ kiriyāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: But, Sīha, what is the right way to describe me?

original: Ahañhi, sīha, kiriyaṁ vadāmi kāyasucaritassa vacīsucaritassa manosucaritassa, anekavihitānaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ kiriyaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: aham hi sīha kiriyam vadāmi kāya su caritassa vacī su caritassa manaḥ su caritassa aneka vihitānam kusalānam dhammānam kiriyam vadāmi
translated: I say that action should be done. I say that good conduct by way of body, good conduct by way of speech, and good conduct by way of mind should be done. I say that many kinds of wholesome things should be done.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the right way to describe me:

original: kiriyavādo samaṇo gotamo, kiriyāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.🔽Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: kiriya vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ kiriyāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti  katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: I am one who teaches a doctrine of action, of doing. I teach a doctrine of action, of doing. I train my disciples in that.🔽But, Sīha, what is the right way to describe me?

original: ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo, ucchedāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
analyzed: uccheda vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ucchedāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: I am one who teaches a doctrine of annihilation, of the destruction of beings. I teach a doctrine of annihilation, of the destruction of beings. I train my disciples in that.

original: Ahañhi, sīha, ucchedaṁ vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa;
analyzed: ahan hi sīha ucchedam vadāmi rāgassa dosassa mohassa
translated: I declare the cutting off of greed, hatred, and delusion,

original: anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ ucchedaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam ucchedam vadāmi
translated: I declare the cutting off of many bad, unwholesome qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way, Sīha, in which one speaking rightly of me

original: ucchedavādo samaṇo gotamo ucchedāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.
analyzed: uccheda vādaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ucchedāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: would speak.

original: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “And what, Sīha, is the way in which one speaking rightly of me

original: jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
analyzed: jegucchī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jegucchitāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: would say that I am a mocker and teach a doctrine of mocking, and train disciples accordingly?

original: Ahañhi, sīha, jigucchāmi kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena;
analyzed: aham hi sīha jigucchāmi kāya duccaritena vacī duccaritena manaḥ duccaritena
translated: I am disgusted with bodily misconduct, with verbal misconduct, with mental misconduct,

original: anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ samāpattiyā jigucchāmi.
analyzed: aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyā jigucchāmi
translated: I am disgusted with the attainment of many bad, unwholesome qualities.🔽This is the way, Sīha, in which one speaking rightly of me

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: would speak.

original: jegucchī samaṇo gotamo, jegucchitāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.
analyzed: jegucchī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jegucchitāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: The ascetic Gotama is disgusted, he teaches a Dhamma of disgust, and he trains his disciples in that.”

original: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “Sīha, there is a way in which one could rightly say of me:

original: venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
analyzed: venayikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ vinayāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is a teacher of non-proliferation, he teaches a Dhamma of non-proliferation, and he trains his disciples in that.’

original: Ahañhi, sīha, vinayāya dhammaṁ desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa;🔽anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ vinayāya dhammaṁ desemi.
analyzed: aham hi sīha vinayāya dhammam desemi rāgassa dosassa mohassa  aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam vinayāya dhammam desemi
translated: Because I teach the Dhamma for the proliferation of greed, hatred, and delusion,🔽and for the non-proliferation of wholesome qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is a way in which one could rightly say of me:

original: venayiko samaṇo gotamo, vinayāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.
analyzed: venayikaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ vinayāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is a teacher of non-proliferation, he teaches a Dhamma of non-proliferation, and he trains his disciples in that.’

original: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “Sīha, there is a way in which one could rightly say of me:

original: tapassī samaṇo gotamo, tapassitāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
analyzed: tapassī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tapassi tāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an ascetic, he teaches a Dhamma of asceticism, and he trains his disciples in that.’

original: Tapanīyāhaṁ, sīha, pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi—
analyzed: tapanīyā āha sīha pāpake akusale dhamme vadāmi
translated: I say that bad unwholesome qualities are to be mortified,🔽and that they are to be mortified by the mortification of sense pleasures.

original: kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ.
analyzed: kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam manaḥ duccarita
translated: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

original: Yassa kho, sīha, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṁ tapassīti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kho sīha tapanīyā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā tam aham tapassi iti vadāmi
translated: One who has abandoned these things that should be scorched, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, eradicated them, and made them non-existent in the future, I say is one who scorches.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, sīha, tapanīyā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.🔽Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya tapassī samaṇo gotamo tapassitāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.🔽Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho sīha tapanīyāḥ pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā  ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya tapassī samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tapassi tāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti  katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned these things that should be scorched, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, eradicated them, and made them non-existent in the future.🔽This is the way in which one speaking rightly of me would speak.🔽“But, Sīha, what is the way in which one speaking rightly of me would speak?🔽“One who is free from the womb, who teaches the Dhamma for the overcoming of the womb, and who trains his disciples in that Dhamma.

original: apagabbho samaṇo gotamo apagabbhatāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ apagabbha tāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: “What, Sīha, is the way in which one speaking rightly of me would speak?

original: Yassa kho, sīha, āyatiṁ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā, tamahaṁ apagabbhoti vadāmi.
analyzed: yassa kho sīha āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā tam aham apagabbhā ti vadāmi
translated: I say that one who has given up future rebirth in the womb, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it so that it is no more subject to future arising, is free from rebirth in the womb.

original: Tathāgatassa kho, sīha, āyatiṁ gabbhaseyyā punabbhavābhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho sīha āyatim gabbhaseyyā punabbhava abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: The Tathāgata has given up future rebirth in the womb, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it so that it is no more subject to future arising.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the method by which one speaking rightly of me would speak.

original: apagabbho samaṇo gotamo, apagabbhatāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti.
analyzed: apagabbhaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ apagabbha tāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is free from rebirth in the womb; he teaches a Dhamma for the removal of rebirth in the womb, and he trains disciples in that Dhamma.’

original: Katamo ca, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: katamaḥ ca sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: And what, Sīha, is the method by which one speaking rightly of me would speak?

original: assattho samaṇo gotamo assāsāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetīti?
analyzed: assatthaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ assāsāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is confident, he teaches a Dhamma for confidence, and he trains disciples in that Dhamma.’

original: Ahañhi, sīha, assattho paramena assāsena, assāsāya dhammaṁ desemi, tena ca sāvake vinemi.
analyzed: aham hi sīha assatthaḥ paramena assāsena assāsāya dhammam desemi tena ca sāvake vinemi
translated: I am confident, Sīha, with the highest confidence, and I teach a Dhamma for confidence, and I train disciples in that Dhamma.

original: Ayaṁ kho, sīha, pariyāyo, yena maṁ pariyāyena sammā vadamāno vadeyya—
analyzed: ayam kho sīha pariyāyaḥ yena mam pariyāyena sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: This is the way I could rightly be described as

original: assattho samaṇo gotamo assāsāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.
analyzed: assatthaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ assāsāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: one who teaches a doctrine of confidence and trains his disciples accordingly.”

original: Evaṁ vutte sīho senāpati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: evam vutte sīhaḥ senāpati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Sīha said to the Blessed One,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante pe
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: “Anuviccakāraṁ kho, sīha, karohi; anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ sādhu hotī”ti.
analyzed: anuviccakāram kho sīha karohi anuviccakāro tumhādisānam ñāta manussānam sādhu hoti iti
translated: “Sīha, you should investigate,

original: “Imināpāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṁ maṁ bhagavā evamāha—🔽‘anuviccakāraṁ kho, sīha, karohi; anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ sādhu hotī’ti.
analyzed: iminā apāha bhante bhagavataḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya atta manaḥ abhiraddhaḥ yam mama bhagavā evam āha  anuviccakāram kho sīha karohi anuviccakāro tumhādisānam ñāta manussānam sādhu hoti iti
translated: “I am even more satisfied and pleased with Master Gotama that he tells me to investigate,

original: Mamañhi, bhante, aññatitthiyā sāvakaṁ labhitvā kevalakappaṁ vesāliṁ paṭākaṁ parihareyyuṁ—‘sīho kho amhākaṁ senāpati sāvakattaṁ upagato’ti.
analyzed: maman hi bhante añña titthiyāḥ sāvakam labhitvā kevala kappam vesālim paṭākam parihareyyu sīhaḥ kho amhākam senāpati sāvaka ttam upagataḥ ti
translated: for when the monastics of other sects get a disciple like me, they parade a banner all over Vesālī: ‘Sīha, the general’s son, has gone over to us!’

original: Atha ca pana maṁ bhagavā evamāha—
analyzed: atha ca pana mam bhagavān evam āha
translated: And yet the Buddha says this to me:

original: ‘anuviccakāraṁ kho, sīha, karohi; anuviccakāro tumhādisānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ sādhu hotī’ti.
analyzed: anuviccakāram kho sīha karohi anuviccakāro tumhādisānam ñāta manussānam sādhu hoti iti
translated: ‘Sīha, you should investigate. It’s good for people like you to investigate.’

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, dutiyampi bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante dutiyam pi bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: For a second time I go to the Buddha for refuge and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: “Dīgharattaṁ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṁ opānabhūtaṁ kulaṁ, yena nesaṁ upagatānaṁ piṇḍakaṁ dātabbaṁ maññeyyāsī”ti.
analyzed: dīgharattam kho te sīha nigaṇṭhānam opāna bhūtam kula yena na īsam upagatānam piṇḍakam dātabbam maññeyyāsi iti
translated: “Sīha, your family has been a supporter of the Jains for a long time. You should consider giving almsfood to them when they come.”

original: “Imināpāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato bhiyyoso mattāya attamano abhiraddho, yaṁ maṁ bhagavā evamāha—
analyzed: iminā apāha bhante bhagavataḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya atta manaḥ abhiraddhaḥ yam mama bhagavā evam āha
translated: “Sir, I’m even more pleased and satisfied that the Buddha says this to me.

original: ‘dīgharattaṁ kho te, sīha, nigaṇṭhānaṁ opānabhūtaṁ kulaṁ, yena nesaṁ upagatānaṁ piṇḍakaṁ dātabbaṁ maññeyyāsī’ti.
analyzed: dīgharattam kho te sīha nigaṇṭhānam opāna bhūtam kula yena na īsam upagatānam piṇḍakam dātabbam maññeyyāsi iti
translated: ‘Sīha, your family has been a supporter of the Jains for a long time. You should consider giving almsfood to them when they come.’

original: Sutaṁ me taṁ, bhante, samaṇo gotamo evamāha—
analyzed: sutam me bhante samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ evam āha
translated: Sir, I have heard that the Buddha says this:

original: ‘mayhameva dānaṁ dātabbaṁ, na aññesaṁ dānaṁ dātabbaṁ; mayhameva sāvakānaṁ dānaṁ dātabbaṁ, na aññesaṁ sāvakānaṁ dānaṁ dātabbaṁ;
analyzed: mayham eva dānam dātabba na aññesam dānam dātabba mayham eva sāvakānam dānam dātabba na aññesam sāvakānam dānam dātabba
translated: ‘Only I should be given gifts, not others. Only my disciples should be given gifts, not the disciples of others.

original: mayhameva dinnaṁ mahapphalaṁ, na aññesaṁ dinnaṁ mahapphalaṁ; mayhameva sāvakānaṁ dinnaṁ mahapphalaṁ, na aññesaṁ sāvakānaṁ dinnaṁ mahapphalan’ti.
analyzed: mayham eva dinnam mahapphala na aññesam dinnam mahapphala mayham eva sāvakānam dinnam mahapphala na aññesam sāvakānam dinnam mahapphalanti
translated: Only what is given to me has great fruit, not what is given to others. Only what is given to my disciples has great fruit, not what is given to the disciples of others.’

original: Atha ca pana maṁ bhagavā nigaṇṭhesupi dāne samādapeti.
analyzed: atha ca pana mam bhagavā dāne samādapa iti
translated: And yet the Buddha encourages me to give to the Jains.

original: Api ca, bhante, mayamettha kālaṁ jānissāma.
analyzed: api ca bhante mayam ettha kālam jānissāma
translated: But, Sir, we will know the right time for that.

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, tatiyampi bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante tatiyam pi bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: For the third time, I go to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha for refuge.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sīhassa senāpatissa anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sīhassa senāpatissa anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha then gave Seniya the householder a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ …pe…
analyzed: dāna katham pe
translated: that is, talk on generosity, talk on morality, talk on heaven, and the dangers, disadvantages, and defilement of sensual pleasures, and the benefits of renunciation.

original: aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: apara ppaccayaḥ satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and he became an independent buddha.

original: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhante bhagavā svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpatiḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Sīha got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati aññataram purisam āṇāpesi
translated: Sīha then instructed a man,

original: “gaccha, bhaṇe, pavattamaṁsaṁ jānāhī”ti.
analyzed: gaccha bhaṇe pavattamasam jānāhi iti
translated: “Go and find out if there’s any meat available.”

original: Atha kho sīho senāpati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālam ārocāpesi kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: The following morning Sīha had various kinds of fine food prepared. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sīhassa senāpatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena sīhassa senāpatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Sīha’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṁ rathikāya rathikaṁ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṁ bāhā paggayha kandanti—
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena sambahulāḥ nigaṇṭhāḥ vesāliyam rathikāya rathikam siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakam bāhā paggayha kandanti
translated: At that time many of the Jain ascetics were wandering in Vesālī. From street to street, from square to square, they raised their arms and cried out,

original: “ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṁ pasuṁ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṁ kataṁ, taṁ samaṇo gotamo jānaṁ uddissakataṁ maṁsaṁ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman”ti.
analyzed: ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlam pasum vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattam kata tam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jānam uddissa katam masam paribhuñjati paṭiccakammanti
translated: “Today General Sīha killed a large animal and prepared a meal for the ascetic Gotama. The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat that has been procured for him after he has ordered it.”

original: Atha kho aññataro puriso yena sīho senāpati tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā sīhassa senāpatissa upakaṇṇake ārocesi—
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ purisaḥ yena sīhaḥ senāpati tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā sīhassa senāpatissa upakaṇṇake ārocesi
translated: A certain man then went to General Sīha and whispered in his ear,

original: “yagghe, bhante, jāneyyāsi, ete sambahulā nigaṇṭhā vesāliyaṁ rathikāya rathikaṁ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṁ bāhā paggayha kandanti—
analyzed: yat he bhante jāneyyāsi ete sambahulāḥ nigaṇṭhāḥ vesāliyam rathikāya rathikam siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakam bāhā paggayha kandanti
translated: “Sir, you should know that many of the Jain ascetics are wandering in Vesālī. From street to street, from square to square, they raise their arms and cry out,

original: ‘ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlaṁ pasuṁ vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattaṁ kataṁ, taṁ samaṇo gotamo jānaṁ uddissakataṁ maṁsaṁ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman’”ti.
analyzed: ajja sīhena senāpatinā thūlam pasum vadhitvā samaṇassa gotamassa bhattam kata tam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jānam uddissa katam masam paribhuñjati paṭiccakammanti
translated: ‘Today General Sīha killed a large animal and prepared a meal for the ascetic Gotama. The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat that has been procured for him after he has ordered it.’”

original: “Alaṁ, ayyo, dīgharattampi te āyasmantā avaṇṇakāmā buddhassa, avaṇṇakāmā dhammassa, avaṇṇakāmā saṅghassa;
analyzed: ala ayyaḥ dīgharattam pi te āyasmantā avaṇṇa kāmāḥ buddhassa avaṇṇa kāmāḥ dhammassa avaṇṇa kāmā saṅghassa
translated: “Enough, sirs. You’ve been disparaging the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha for a long time.

original: na ca pana te āyasmantā jiridanti taṁ bhagavantaṁ asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhantā;
analyzed: na ca pana te āyasmantā jiridanti tam bhagavantam asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhantā
translated: But you haven’t been able to destroy the Buddha’s reputation, and you won’t be able to destroy the reputation of the Teaching and the Sangha.

original: na ca mayaṁ jīvitahetupi sañcicca pāṇaṁ jīvitā voropeyyāmā”ti.🔽Atha kho sīho senāpati buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: na ca mayam sañcit ca pāṇam jīvitā voropeyyāma ati  atha kho sīhaḥ senāpati buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim ekamantam nisīdi
translated: And we won’t kill anyone, not even for the sake of our lives.”🔽Sīha then served and satisfied the Sangha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with his own hands with exquisite staple and non-staple food. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Sīha took a low seat and sat to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho sīhaṁ senāpatiṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho sīham senāpatim bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “na, bhikkhave, jānaṁ uddissakataṁ maṁsaṁ paribhuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave jānam uddissa katam masam
translated: “You shouldn’t eat meat that you know was prepared specifically for you.

original: Yo paribhuñjeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ paribhuñjeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tikoṭiparisuddhaṁ macchamaṁsaṁ—adiṭṭhaṁ assutaṁ aparisaṅkitan”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave ti koṭi parisuddham mat chamasa adiṭṭham a sutam a parisaṅkitam ti
translated: I allow you to eat fish and meat that are the pure threefold preparation: if you haven’t seen, heard, or suspected that they have been prepared specifically for you.”

original: 20. Kappiyabhūmianujānana
translated: 1.1 The allowance for a suitable place

original: Tena kho pana samayena vesālī subhikkhā hoti susassā sulabhapiṇḍā, sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena vesālī subhikkhā hoti su sassā sulabha piṇḍā sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetu
translated: At that time Vesālī was well-stocked with food and the harvest was good, so almsfood was abundant and it was easy to get by on gleanings.

original: Atha kho bhagavato rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—🔽“yāni tāni mayā bhikkhūnaṁ anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabhapiṇḍe anto vuṭṭhaṁ
analyzed: atha kho bhagavataḥ rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi  yāni tāni mayā bhikkhūnam anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabha piṇḍe antar vuṭṭha
translated: Then, while reflecting in private, the Buddha thought,

original: anto pakkaṁ sāmaṁ pakkaṁ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṁ tato nīhaṭaṁ purebhattaṁ paṭiggahitaṁ
analyzed: antar pakkam sāmam pakkam uggahita paṭiggahitakam tatas nīhaṭam purebhattam paṭiggahita
translated: “I have allowed the monks to eat what has been stored indoors, what has been cooked indoors, what has been cooked by themselves, what has been received by themselves, what has been brought to them, what has been received before the meal,

original: vanaṭṭhaṁ pokkharaṭṭhaṁ, ajjāpi nu kho tāni bhikkhū paribhuñjantī”ti.
analyzed: vanaṭṭham pokkharaṭṭha ajja api nu kho tāni bhikkhū paribhuñjanti iti
translated: what has been stored in the wilderness, and what has been stored in a forest. But do the monks still eat these?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: In the evening, the Buddha came out of retreat and addressed Venerable Ānanda:

original: “yāni tāni, ānanda, mayā bhikkhūnaṁ anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabhapiṇḍe🔽anto vuṭṭhaṁ anto pakkaṁ sāmaṁ pakkaṁ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṁ tato nīhaṭaṁ purebhattaṁ
analyzed: yāni tāni ānanda mayā bhikkhūnam anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabha piṇḍe  antar vuṭṭham antar pakkam sāmam pakkam uggahita paṭiggahitakam tatas nīhaṭam purebhatta
translated: “Ānanda, I’ve allowed the monks to eat cooked food that they’ve asked for when there’s famine, when there’s a shortage of food, when almsfood is hard to get.

original: paṭiggahitaṁ vanaṭṭhaṁ pokkharaṭṭhaṁ, ajjāpi nu kho tāni bhikkhū paribhuñjantī”ti?
analyzed: paṭiggahitam vanaṭṭham pokkharaṭṭha ajja api nu kho tāni bhikkhū paribhuñjanti iti
translated: Cooked food that they’ve cooked themselves, that they’ve stored indoors, that they’ve cooked indoors, that they’ve asked for and then cooked, that they’ve brought back from a different location, that they’ve received before the meal, that they’ve received after the meal, that they’ve received in the wilderness, and that they’ve received in a charnel ground. But do the monks still eat these?”

original: “Paribhuñjanti, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: paribhuñjanti bhagavā ati
translated: “They do, Sir.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha then gave a teaching, and after instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the monks with a teaching, he dismissed them, saying,

original: “yāni tāni, bhikkhave, mayā bhikkhūnaṁ anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabhapiṇḍe🔽anto vuṭṭhaṁ anto pakkaṁ sāmaṁ pakkaṁ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṁ tato nīhaṭaṁ purebhattaṁ
analyzed: yāni tāni bhikkhave mayā bhikkhūnam anuññātāni dubbhikkhe dussasse dullabha piṇḍe  antar vuṭṭham antar pakkam sāmam pakkam uggahita paṭiggahitakam tatas nīhaṭam purebhatta
translated: “Monks, I’ve allowed the monks to eat cooked food that they’ve asked for when there’s famine, when there’s a shortage of food, when almsfood is hard to get.

original: paṭiggahitaṁ vanaṭṭhaṁ pokkharaṭṭhaṁ, tānāhaṁ ajjatagge paṭikkhipāmi.
analyzed: paṭiggahitam vanaṭṭham pokkharaṭṭha tāna aham ajja tagge paṭikkhipāmi
translated: Cooked food that they’ve cooked themselves, that they’ve stored indoors, that they’ve cooked indoors, that they’ve asked for and then cooked, that they’ve brought back from a different location, that they’ve received before the meal, that they’ve received after the meal, that they’ve received in the wilderness, and that they’ve received in a charnel ground. But from today onwards I rescind this.”

original: Na, bhikkhave, anto vuṭṭhaṁ anto pakkaṁ sāmaṁ pakkaṁ uggahitapaṭiggahitakaṁ paribhuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhave antar vuṭṭham antar pakkam sāmam pakkam uggahita paṭiggahitakam
translated: “You should not eat fresh or cooked food that you have received from inside a monastery.

original: Yo paribhuñjeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ paribhuñjeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If you eat it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Na ca, bhikkhave, tato nīhaṭaṁ purebhattaṁ paṭiggahitaṁ vanaṭṭhaṁ pokkharaṭṭhaṁ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṁ paribhuñjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na ca bhikkhave tatas nīhaṭam purebhattam paṭiggahitam vanaṭṭham pokkharaṭṭham bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittam paribhuñjitabba
translated: “You should not eat wild or cultivated rice that you have received before noon on the same day, if you have refused fresh food after returning from a direction where there are no inhabited areas.

original: Yo paribhuñjeyya, yathādhammo kāretabbo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ paribhuñjeyya yathādhammo kāretabbo ti
translated: If you eat it, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena jānapadā manussā bahuṁ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena jānapadāḥ manussāḥ bahum loṇam pi telam pi taṇḍulam pi khādanīyam pi
translated: At that time people from the countryside brought a lot of salt, oil, rice, and fresh food

original: sakaṭesu āropetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake sakaṭaparivaṭṭaṁ karitvā acchanti—“yadā paṭipāṭiṁ
analyzed: sakaṭesu āropetvā baha ārāma koṭṭhake sakaṭa parivaṭṭam karitvā acchantiyadā paṭipāṭi
translated: and left it in carts at the gate of the monastery, saying, “When we get our turn,

original: labhissāma, tadā bhattaṁ karissāmā”ti.
analyzed: labhissāma tadā bhattam karissāma ati
translated: we’ll cook it.”

original: Mahā ca megho uggato hoti.
analyzed: mahā ca meghaḥ uggataḥ hoti
translated: And a great cloud had risen.

original: Atha kho te manussā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ
analyzed: atha kho te manussāḥ yena āyasmantaḥ ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānanda
translated: Those people then went to Venerable Ānanda

original: etadavocuṁ—“idha, bhante ānanda, bahuṁ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi
analyzed: etat avocuḥ idha bhante ānanda bahum loṇam pi telam pi taṇḍulam pi khādanīyam pi
translated: They said this to him: “Venerable Ānanda, there’s a lot of salt, oil, rice, and fresh foods

original: sakaṭesu āropitā tiṭṭhanti, mahā ca megho uggato; kathaṁ nu kho, bhante ānanda, paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: sakaṭesu āropitā tiṭṭhanti mahā ca meghaḥ uggataḥ katham nu kho bhante ānanda paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: that are loaded on carts and waiting. And a great cloud has risen. What should we do?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: Ānanda told the Buddha.

original: “Tena hānanda, saṅgho paccantimaṁ vihāraṁ kappiyabhūmiṁ sammannitvā tattha vāsetu, yaṁ saṅgho ākaṅkhati vihāraṁ vā aḍḍhayogaṁ vā pāsādaṁ vā hammiyaṁ vā guhaṁ vā.
analyzed: tena ha ānanda saṅghaḥ paccantimam vihāram kappiya bhūmim sammannitvā tattha vāsetu yam saṅghaḥ ākaṅkhati vihāram vā aḍḍhayogam vā pāsādam vā hammiyam vā guham vā
translated: “Well then, Ānanda, the Sangha should designate a dwelling in the border region as the right area. And the Sangha may then stay there in a dwelling, a stilt house, a multi-storied building, a cave, or a cell, whichever it likes.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, sammannitabbā.
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave sammannitabbā
translated: And it should be designated like this.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ
translated: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

original: ‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: ‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmaṁ vihāraṁ kappiyabhūmiṁ sammanneyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ itthannāmam vihāram kappiya bhūmim sammanneyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should designate such-and-such a dwelling as the right area.

original: Esā ñatti.
analyzed: esā ñatti
translated: This is the motion.

original: Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmaṁ vihāraṁ kappiyabhūmiṁ sammannati.
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmam vihāram kappiya bhūmim sammannati
translated: The Sangha designates such-and-such a dwelling as the right area.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa vihārassa kappiyabhūmiyā sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa vihārassa kappiya bhūmiyā sammuti saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of designating such-and-such a place as the area for the use of the dwelling should remain silent.

original: yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.
analyzed: yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya
translated: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.

original: Sammato saṅghena itthannāmo vihāro kappiyabhūmi.
analyzed: sammataḥ saṅghena itthannāmaḥ vihāro kappiya bhūmi
translated: The Sangha has designated such-and-such a place as the area for the use of the dwelling.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena manussā tattheva sammutiyā kappiyabhūmiyā yāguyo pacanti, bhattāni pacanti, sūpāni sampādenti, maṁsāni koṭṭenti, kaṭṭhāni phālenti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena manussā tattha iva sammutiyā kappiya bhūmiyā yāguyaḥ pacanti bhattāni pacanti sūpāni sampādenti masāni koṭṭenti kaṭṭhāni phālenti
translated: At that time people were cooking rice porridges, rice, and fresh food right there in the area for the use of the dwelling. They were chopping meat, splitting firewood, and pounding rice.

original: Assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya uccāsaddaṁ mahāsaddaṁ kākoravasaddaṁ, sutvāna āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya uccāsaddam mahāsaddam kākoravasadda sutvāna āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Early in the morning the Buddha got up and heard the loud noise. He asked Venerable Ānanda,

original: “kiṁ nu kho so, ānanda, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo kākoravasaddo”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho saḥ ānanda uccā saddaḥ mahā saddaḥ kākorava saddaḥ iti
translated: “Ānanda, what’s that loud noise?”🔽“Sir, people are cooking rice porridges, rice, and fresh food right there in the area for the use of the dwelling. They are chopping meat, splitting firewood, and pounding rice.”

original: “Etarahi, bhante, manussā tattheva sammutiyā kappiyabhūmiyā yāguyo pacanti, bhattāni pacanti, sūpāni sampādenti, maṁsāni koṭṭenti, kaṭṭhāni phālenti.
analyzed: etarahi bhante manussā tattha iva sammutiyā kappiya bhūmiyā yāguyo pacanti bhattāni pacanti sūpāni sampādenti masāni koṭṭenti kaṭṭhāni phālenti
translated: “At present, Sir, people are cooking rice porridges, rice, and curries right there on the site that has been agreed upon as suitable.

original: So eso, bhagavā, uccāsaddo mahāsaddo kākoravasaddo”ti.
analyzed: saḥ esaḥ bhagavā uccā saddaḥ mahā saddaḥ kākorava saddaḥ iti
translated: That’s why there’s this loud noise.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: After giving a teaching on that occasion, the Buddha addressed the monks:

original: “na, bhikkhave, sammuti kappiyabhūmi paribhuñjitabbā.
analyzed: na bhikkhave sammuti kappiya bhūmi paribhuñjitabbā
translated: “You shouldn’t use a site that has been agreed upon as suitable.

original: Yo paribhuñjeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ paribhuñjeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tisso kappiyabhūmiyo—
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave tissaḥ kappiya bhūmiyaḥ
translated: I allow three kinds of sites that are suitable:

original: ussāvanantikaṁ gonisādikaṁ gahapatin”ti.
analyzed: ussāvana ntikam gonisādikam gahapatinti
translated: a site that has been approved by a majority vote, a site that has been approved by a committee, and a site that has been approved by the owner.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā yasojo gilāno hoti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena āyasmā yasojaḥ gilānaḥ hoti
translated: On one occasion Venerable Yasoja was sick.

original: Tassatthāya bhesajjāni āhariyanti.
analyzed: tassa atthāya bhesajjāni āhariyanti
translated: Medicines were brought for him.

original: Tāni bhikkhū bahi vāsenti.
analyzed: tāni bhikkhū bahi vāsenti
translated: The monks stored them outside.

original: Ukkapiṇḍakāpi khādanti, corāpi haranti.
analyzed: khādanti corāḥ api haranti
translated: Squirrels ate them and thieves stole them.

original: Bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: bhagavato etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.

original: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sammutiṁ kappiyabhūmiṁ paribhuñjituṁ.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave sammutim kappiya bhūmim paribhuñjitu
translated: “Monks, I allow you to use a place that has been designated as suitable.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, catasso kappiyabhūmiyo—
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave catasso kappiya bhūmiyaḥ
translated: I allow four kinds of suitable places:

original: ussāvanantikaṁ gonisādikaṁ gahapatiṁ sammutin”ti.
analyzed: ussāvana ntikam gonisādikam gahapatim
translated: a place that has been approved by proclamation, a place where cattle rest, a place belonging to a householder, and a place that has been designated.”

original: Sīhabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito catuttho.
analyzed: sīhabhāṇa vāro niṭṭhito catuttho
translated: The fourth section for recitation on the one from Sīha is finished.

original: 21. Meṇḍakagahapativatthu
analyzed: meṇḍaka gahapati vatthu
translated: The account of the householder Meṇḍaka

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena bhaddiya nagare meṇḍakaḥ gahapati paṭivasati
translated: At that time the householder Meṇḍaka was living in the town of Bhaddiya.

original: Tassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo hoti—
analyzed: tassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: He had this kind of power and influence:

original: sīsaṁ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṁ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṁ pūreti.
analyzed: sīsam nahāyitvā dhaññāgāram sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāram pūreti
translated: after washing his head, he would sweep out his granary and sit outside the door. A stream of grain would then fall from the sky and fill the granary.

original: Bhariyāya evarūpo iddhānubhāvo hoti—
analyzed: evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: His wife had this kind of power and influence:

original: ekaṁyeva āḷhakathālikaṁ upanisīditvā ekañca sūpabhiñjanakaṁ dāsakammakaraporisaṁ bhattena parivisati, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: ekayā iva āḷhaka thālikam upanisīditvā ekañca su upabhiñjanakam dāsa kammakara porisam bhattena parivisati na tāva tam khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: after sitting down next to a single grain measure and a single pot of curry, she would serve a meal to the slaves, workers, and servants. It would not run out as long as she did not get up.

original: Puttassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo hoti—
analyzed: puttassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: His son had this kind of power and influence:

original: ekaṁyeva sahassathavikaṁ gahetvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṁ vetanaṁ deti, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāvassa hatthagatā.
analyzed: ekayā iva sahassa thavikam gahetvā dāsa kammakara porisassa cha māsikam vetanam deti na tāva tam khiyyati yāva assa hattha gatā
translated: He takes a thousand-coins bag, and gives his slaves, servants, and workers their six-month wages from it, and it’s not even finished.

original: Suṇisāya evarūpo iddhānubhāvo hoti—
analyzed: evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: His wife has this kind of supernormal power:

original: ekaṁyeva catudoṇikaṁ piṭakaṁ upanisīditvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṁ bhattaṁ deti, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: ekayā iva catudoṇikam piṭakam upanisīditvā dāsa kammakara porisassa cha māsikam bhattam deti na tāva tam khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: She sits down next to a four-liter basket and gives his slaves, servants, and workers their six-month food from it, and it’s not even finished.

original: Dāsassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo hoti—
analyzed: dāsassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: His slave has this kind of supernormal power:

original: ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchanti.🔽Assosi kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro—
analyzed: ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyaḥ gacchanti  assosi kho rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ
translated: When he’s plowing with one plow, seven furrows are made.🔽King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha heard

original: “amhākaṁ kira vijite bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati.
analyzed: amhākam kira vijite bhaddiya nagare meṇḍakaḥ gahapati paṭivasati
translated: that in his kingdom, in the town of Bhaddiya, there lived a householder named Meṇḍaka.

original: Tassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo—
analyzed: tassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: He had this kind of supernormal power:

original: sīsaṁ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṁ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṁ pūreti.
analyzed: sīsam nahāyitvā dhaññāgāram sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāram pūreti
translated: After washing his head, he would sweep out his grain storehouse and sit outside the door. A stream of grain would fall from the sky and fill the storehouse.

original: Bhariyāya evarūpo iddhānubhāvo—
analyzed: bhariyāya evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: His wife had this kind of supernormal power:

original: ekaṁyeva āḷhakathālikaṁ upanisīditvā ekañca sūpabhiñjanakaṁ dāsakammakaraporisaṁ bhattena parivisati, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: ekayā iva āḷhaka thālikam upanisīditvā ekañca su upabhiñjanakam dāsa kammakara porisam bhattena parivisati na tāva tam khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: He sits down next to a single grain measure of rice and a single saucer of curry and serves a slave, worker, or servant with it, and it doesn’t run out as long as he doesn’t get up.

original: Puttassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo—
analyzed: puttassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: His son has this kind of supernormal power:

original: ekaṁyeva sahassathavikaṁ gahetvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṁ vetanaṁ deti, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāvassa hatthagatā.
analyzed: ekayā iva sahassa thavikam gahetvā dāsa kammakara porisassa cha māsikam vetanam deti na tāva tam khiyyati yāva assa hattha gatā
translated: He takes a single thousand-coin bag and gives it to the slaves, workers, and servants as their six-monthly wage, and it doesn’t run out as long as he holds it.

original: Suṇisāya evarūpo iddhānubhāvo—
analyzed: evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: His daughter-in-law has this kind of supernormal power:

original: ekaṁyeva catudoṇikaṁ piṭakaṁ upanisīditvā dāsakammakaraporisassa chamāsikaṁ bhattaṁ deti, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: ekayā iva catudoṇikam piṭakam upanisīditvā dāsa kammakara porisassa cha māsikam bhattam deti na tāva tam khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: She sits down next to a single four-liter basket of rice and serves the slaves, workers, and servants with it for a day, and it doesn’t run out as long as she doesn’t get up.

original: Dāsassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo—
analyzed: dāsassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: His slave has this kind of supernormal power:

original: ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchantī”ti.
analyzed: ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyaḥ gacchanti iti
translated: He ploughs with a single plowshare seven furrows.”

original: Atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro aññataraṁ sabbatthakaṁ mahāmattaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ aññataram sabbatthakam mahāmattam āmantesi
translated: King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha then addressed a certain all-purpose minister,

original: “amhākaṁ kira, bhaṇe, vijite bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati.
analyzed: amhākam kira bhaṇe vijite bhaddiya nagare meṇḍakaḥ gahapati paṭivasati
translated: “Sir, I hear that in our kingdom, in the town of Bhaddiya, there lives a householder named Meṇḍaka.

original: Tassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo—
analyzed: tassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: He has this kind of psychic power:

original: sīsaṁ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṁ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṁ pūreti.🔽Bhariyāya …pe…🔽puttassa …
analyzed: sīsam nahāyitvā dhaññāgāram sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdati antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāram pūreti  bhariyāya pe  puttassa
translated: after bathing his head, he sweeps out his granary and sits outside the door. A stream of grain falls from the sky and fills the granary.🔽His wife …🔽his son …

original: suṇisāya …
analyzed: su nisāya
translated: his daughter-in-law …

original: dāsassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo, ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchantīti.
analyzed: dāsassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyaḥ gacchanti iti
translated: his slave has this kind of psychic power: when he ploughs with a single plowshare, seven furrows are made.”

original: Gaccha, bhaṇe, jānāhi.
analyzed: gaccha bhaṇe jānāhi
translated: “Go and find out.

original: Yathā mayā sāmaṁ diṭṭho, evaṁ tava diṭṭho bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: yathā mayā sāmam diṭṭhaḥ evam tava diṭṭhaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: What I’ve seen with my own eyes is the same as what you’ve seen.”

original: “Evaṁ, devā”ti kho so mahāmatto rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paṭissuṇitvā caturaṅginiyā senāya yena bhaddiyaṁ tena pāyāsi.
analyzed: eva deva ati kho saḥ mahāmattaḥ raññaḥ māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paṭissuṇitvā caturaṅginiyā senāya yena bhaddiyam tena pāyāsi
translated: “Yes, sir,” replied the minister. He then set out for Bhaddiya with the fourfold army.

original: Anupubbena yena bhaddiyaṁ yena meṇḍako gahapati tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā meṇḍakaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: anupubbena yena bhaddiyam yena meṇḍakaḥ gahapati tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā meṇḍakam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: When he eventually arrived, he went to Meṇḍaka and said,

original: “ahañhi, gahapati, raññā āṇatto—
analyzed: ahañhi gahapati raññā āṇatto
translated: “Householder, I’ve been instructed by King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha:

original: ‘amhākaṁ kira, bhaṇe, vijite bhaddiyanagare meṇḍako gahapati paṭivasati, tassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo, sīsaṁ nahāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: amhākam kira bhaṇe vijite bhaddiya nagare meṇḍakaḥ gahapati paṭivasati tassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ sīsam nahāyitvā pe
translated: ‘In our kingdom, in the town of Bhaddiya, there’s a householder called Meṇḍaka who has such and such supernormal powers. He bathes his head, and …

original: bhariyāya …
analyzed: bhariyāya
translated: his wife …

original: puttassa …
analyzed: puttassa
translated: his son …

original: suṇisāya …
analyzed: su nisāya
translated: his daughter-in-law …

original: dāsassa evarūpo iddhānubhāvo, ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyo gacchantīti, gaccha, bhaṇe, jānāhi.
analyzed: dāsassa evarūpaḥ iddha anubhāvaḥ ekena naṅgalena kasantassa satta sītāyaḥ gacchanti iti gaccha bhaṇe jānāhi
translated: and his slave has such and such supernormal powers. When he ploughs with a single plowshare, seven furrows are made. Go and find out about this.’

original: Yathā mayā sāmaṁ diṭṭho, evaṁ tava diṭṭho bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: yathā mayā sāmam diṭṭhaḥ evam tava diṭṭhaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: ‘What I’ve seen with my own eyes will be seen with your own eyes.’

original: Passāma te, gahapati, iddhānubhāvan”ti.
analyzed: passāma te gahapati iddha anubhāvanti
translated: We want to see your supernormal powers.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati sīsaṁ nahāyitvā dhaññāgāraṁ sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdi, antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāraṁ pūresi.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati sīsam nahāyitvā dhaññāgāram sammajjāpetvā bahidvāre nisīdi antalikkhā dhaññassa dhārā opatitvā dhaññāgāram pūresi
translated: Meṇḍaka then bathed his head, swept the grain storehouse, and sat outside the door. A stream of grain fell from the sky and filled the storehouse.

original: “Diṭṭho te, gahapati, iddhānubhāvo.
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ te gahapati iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: “We’ve seen your supernormal powers.

original: Bhariyāya te iddhānubhāvaṁ passissāmā”ti.
analyzed: bhariyāya te iddha anubhāvam passissāma ati
translated: Now we want to see those of your wife.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhariyaṁ āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha khalu meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhariyam āṇāpesi
translated: Meṇḍaka then told his wife,

original: “tena hi caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ bhattena parivisā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi caturaṅginim senam bhattena parivisāti
translated: “Please feed the fourfold army.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhariyā ekaṁyeva āḷhakathālikaṁ upanisīditvā ekañca sūpabhiñjanakaṁ caturaṅginiṁ senaṁ bhattena parivisi, na tāva taṁ khiyyati, yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhariyā ekayā iva āḷhaka thālikam upanisīditvā ekam ca su upabhiñjanakam caturaṅginim senam bhattena parivisi na tāva tam khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: Then, sitting down next to a single grain measure of rice and a single saucer of curry, she served the fourfold army with food, and it did not run out as long as she did not get up.

original: “Diṭṭho te, gahapati, bhariyāyapi iddhānubhāvo.
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ te gahapati iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: “We’ve seen the supernormal powers of your wife.

original: Puttassa te iddhānubhāvaṁ passissāmā”ti.
analyzed: puttassa te iddha anubhāvam passissāma ati
translated: Now let’s see those of your son.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati puttaṁ āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati puttam āṇāpesi
translated: Meṇḍaka told his son,

original: “tena hi caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṁ vetanaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi caturaṅginiyā senāya cha māsikam vetanam dehi iti
translated: “Well then, give the fourfold army its six months’ wages.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa putto ekaṁyeva sahassathavikaṁ gahetvā caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṁ vetanaṁ adāsi, na tāva taṁ khiyyati, yāvassa hatthagatā.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa puttaḥ ekayā iva sahassa thavikam gahetvā caturaṅginiyā senāya cha māsikam vetanam adāsi na tāva tam khiyyati yāva assa hattha gatā
translated: Meṇḍaka’s son took a single bag containing a thousand coins and gave the fourfold army its six months’ wages, and it did not run out as long as he held it.

original: “Diṭṭho te, gahapati, puttassapi iddhānubhāvo.
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ te gahapati puttassa api iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: “We’ve seen the supernormal powers of your son.

original: Suṇisāya te iddhānubhāvaṁ passissāmā”ti.
analyzed: suṇisāya te iddha anubhāvam passissāma ati
translated: Now let’s see those of your daughter-in-law.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati suṇisaṁ āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha khalu meṇḍakaḥ gahapati suṇisam āṇāpesi
translated: Meṇḍaka told his daughter-in-law,

original: “tena hi caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṁ bhattaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi caturaṅginiyā senāya cha māsikam bhattam dehi iti
translated: “Well then, give them six months’ rations.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa suṇisā ekaṁyeva catudoṇikaṁ piṭakaṁ upanisīditvā caturaṅginiyā senāya chamāsikaṁ bhattaṁ adāsi, na tāva taṁ khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa suṇisā ekayā iva catu doṇikam piṭakam upanisīditvā caturaṅginiyā senāya cha māsikam bhattam adāsi na tāva tam khiyyati yāva sā na vuṭṭhāti
translated: Then Meṇḍaka’s wife sat down right there on a four-doṇa basket and gave six months’ rations to the fourfold army. It didn’t run out as long as she didn’t get up.

original: “Diṭṭho te, gahapati, suṇisāyapi iddhānubhāvo.
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ te gahapati iddha anubhāvaḥ
translated: “We’ve seen the supernormal powers of your wife.

original: Dāsassa te iddhānubhāvaṁ passissāmā”ti.🔽“Mayhaṁ kho, sāmi, dāsassa iddhānubhāvo khette passitabbo”ti.
analyzed: dāsassa te iddha anubhāvam passissāma ati  mayham kho sāmi dāsassa iddha anubhāvaḥ khette passitabbo ti
translated: Now let’s see the supernormal powers of your slave.”🔽“Sir, you can see the supernormal powers of my slave in the field.”

original: “Alaṁ, gahapati, diṭṭho te dāsassapi iddhānubhāvo”ti.
analyzed: ala gahapati diṭṭhaḥ te dāsassa api iddha anubhāvaḥ ti
translated: “That’s enough. We’ve seen the supernormal powers of your slave.”

original: Atha kho so mahāmatto caturaṅginiyā senāya punadeva rājagahaṁ paccāgañchi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ mahāmatto caturaṅginiyā senāya punadeva rājagaham paccāgañchi
translated: Then that minister returned to Rājagaha with the fourfold army.

original: Yena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: yena rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāro tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā raññaḥ māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa etam attham ārocesi
translated: He went to King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha and told him what had happened.

original: Atha kho bhagavā vesāliyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena bhaddiyaṁ tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā vesāliyam yathābhirantam viharitvā yena bhaddiyam tena cārikam pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: After staying at Vesālī for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Bhaddiya with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

original: Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena bhaddiyaṁ tadavasari.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena bhaddiyam tat avasari
translated: He eventually arrived at Bhaddiya.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane
translated: He stayed in the Jātiyā Grove.

original: Assosi kho meṇḍako gahapati—
analyzed: assosi kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati
translated: Meṇḍaka heard that

original: “samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito bhaddiyaṁ anuppatto bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ bhaddiyam anuppattaḥ bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane
translated: “the ascetic Gotama, the Sakyan, who has gone forth from the Sakyan clan, has arrived at Bhaddiya and is staying in the Jātiyā Grove.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhagavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato—
analyzed: tam kha pana bhagavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And this good report about him has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: ‘This Blessed One is perfected, a fully Awakened One, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, the Awakened One, the Blessed One.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has realized this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhadraṁ bhadraṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi yānehi bhaddiyā niyyāsi bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: atha khalu meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhadrāni bhadrāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhadram bhadram yānam abhiruhitvā bhadrehi bhadrehi yānehi bhaddiyā niyyāsi bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: Then Meṇḍaka had the finest vehicles harnessed. He mounted one of them and set out from Bhaddiya for Sāvatthī.

original: Addasaṁsu kho sambahulā titthiyā meṇḍakaṁ gahapatiṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ, disvāna meṇḍakaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: kho sambahulāḥ titthiyāḥ meṇḍakam gahapatim dūratas uva āgacchanta disvāna meṇḍakam gahapatim etat avocuḥ
translated: A number of monastics saw him coming and asked,

original: “kahaṁ tvaṁ, gahapati, gacchasī”ti?
analyzed: kaham tva gahapati gacchasi iti
translated: “Where are you going, householder?”

original: “Gacchāmahaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
analyzed: gacchāmaha bhante bhagavantam samaṇam gotamam dassanāya ati
translated: “I’m going to see the Buddha, the perfected and fully awakened one.”

original: “Kiṁ pana tvaṁ, gahapati, kiriyavādo samāno akiriyavādaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi?
analyzed: kim pana tva gahapati kiriya vādaḥ samānaḥ a kiriya vādam samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissasi
translated: “But, householder, how can you, who believe in action, go to see the ascetic Gotama, who believes in inaction?

original: Samaṇo hi, gahapati, gotamo akiriyavādo akiriyāya dhammaṁ deseti, tena ca sāvake vinetī”ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ hi gahapati gotamaḥ a kiriya vādaḥ a kiriyāya dhammam deseti tena ca sāvake vineti iti
translated: For the ascetic Gotama is an inactionist; he teaches the Dhamma for the sake of inaction, and in that trains his disciples.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa etat ahosi
translated: Then Meṇḍaka thought:

original: “nissaṁsayaṁ kho so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bhavissati, yathayime titthiyā usūyantī”ti.🔽Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinnassa kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: nissasayam kho so bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bhavissati yathā ime titthiyāḥ usūyanti iti  yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnassa kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: “No doubt this Blessed One is a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, since these sectarians are so hostile towards him.”🔽He went by vehicle as far as the ground would allow, then alighted and continued on foot to where the Buddha was. He bowed, sat down,

original: dānakathaṁ …pe…
analyzed: dāna katham pe
translated: and the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

original: aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: apara ppaccayaḥ satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then said to the Buddha,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante pe
translated: “Wonderful, sir! Wonderful! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gataṁ.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gata
translated: Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.

original: Adhivāsetu ca me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu ca me bhante bhagavā svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: And please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Meṇḍaka got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālam ārocāpesi kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: The following morning Meṇḍaka had various kinds of fine food prepared. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena meṇḍakassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena meṇḍakassa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Meṇḍaka’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhariyā ca putto ca suṇisā ca dāso ca yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakassa gahapatissa bhariyā ca putto ca suṇisā ca dāsaḥ ca yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: Then Meṇḍaka’s wife, son, daughter-in-law, and slave went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.🔽The Buddha gave them a graduated talk:

original: Tesaṁ bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tesam bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: a talk on generosity, on virtue, and on heaven,

original: dānakathaṁ …pe…
analyzed: dāna katham pe
translated: and he explained the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of giving them up. When he knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident,

original: aparappaccayā satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: aparappaccayā satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: he explained the teachings unique to the Buddhas:🔽suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.🔽Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly, in the same way, while they were sitting right there, Meṇḍaka’s wife, son, daughter-in-law, and slave experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante …pe…🔽ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante pe  ete bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”

original: Upāsake no bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṁ gate”ti.
analyzed: upāsake naḥ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇam gata iti
translated: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena🔽sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ekamantaṁ
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena  sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim ekamanta
translated: Meṇḍaka then served and satisfied the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha with his own hands with a variety of good food.🔽When the Buddha had finished his meal, he got up from his seat and went to the dwelling.

original: nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: nisīdi eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Meṇḍaka then said to the Buddha,

original: “yāva, bhante, bhagavā bhaddiye viharati tāva ahaṁ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dhuvabhattenā”ti.
analyzed: yāva bhante bhagavā bhaddiye viharati tāva aham buddha ppamukhassa bhikkhu saṅghassa dhuva bhattena ati
translated: “As long as the Buddha stays in Bhaddiya, I will provide rice porridge for the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā meṇḍakaṁ gahapatiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā meṇḍakam gahapatim dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Then, after instructing, inspiring, and gladdening Meṇḍaka with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: 22. Pañcagorasādianujānana
translated: 1.1 The allowance for five pungent plants, etc.🔽When the Buddha had stayed at Bhaddiya for as long as he liked, he said to Venerable Ānanda, “Come, Ānanda, we will go to Aṅguttarāpa.”🔽“Yes, Sir.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhaddiye yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā meṇḍakaṁ gahapatiṁ anāpucchā yena aṅguttarāpo tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhaddiye yathābhirantam viharitvā meṇḍakam gahapatim anāpucchā yena aṅguttarāpo tena cārikam pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: The Buddha then traveled through the country until he reached Aṅguttarāpa, where he stayed in a banyan grove near Aṅguttarāpa.

original: Assosi kho meṇḍako gahapati—
analyzed: assosi kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati
translated: Meṇḍaka heard that

original: “bhagavā kira yena aṅguttarāpo tena cārikaṁ pakkanto mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehī”ti.
analyzed: bhagavā kira yena aṅguttarāpo tena cārikam pakkantaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi iti
translated: the Buddha had arrived at Aṅguttarāpa.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati dāse ca kammakare ca āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati dāse ca kammakare ca āṇāpesi
translated: He then told his slaves and workers,

original: “tena hi, bhaṇe, bahuṁ loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi sakaṭesu āropetvā
analyzed: tena hi bhaṇe bahum loṇam pi telam pi taṇḍulam pi khādanīyam pi sakaṭesu āropetvā
translated: “Well then, drive the carts back to the village, loaded with salt, oil, rice, and fresh food.

original: āgacchatha, aḍḍhatelasāni ca gopālakasatāni aḍḍhatelasāni ca dhenusatāni ādāya āgacchantu,
analyzed: āgacchatha aḍḍhatelasāni ca gopālaka satāni aḍḍhatelasāni ca dhenu satāni ādāya āgacchantu
translated: And tell the cowherds to bring back three thousand cows, two thousand of which are giving milk and one thousand of which are calves.

original: yattha bhagavantaṁ passissāma tattha taruṇena khīrena bhojessāmā”ti.
analyzed: yattha bhagavantam passissāma tattha taruṇena khīrena bhojessāma ati
translated: Wherever we see the Buddha, we’ll feed him fresh milk.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṁ antarāmagge kantāre sambhāvesi.🔽Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhagavantam antarāmagge kantāre sambhāvesi  atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: Meṇḍaka then prepared a meal for the Buddha on the road in the wilderness.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam ṭhitaḥ khalu meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then went to the Buddha, bowed, and said,

original: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhante bhagavā svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapatiḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Meṇḍaka bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi—“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālam ārocāpesi kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: The following morning Meṇḍaka had various kinds of fine food prepared. He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena meṇḍakassa gahapatissa parivesanā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena meṇḍakassa gahapatissa parivesanā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Meṇḍaka’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati aḍḍhatelasāni gopālakasatāni āṇāpesi—
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati aḍḍhatelasāni gopālaka satāni āṇāpesi
translated: Meṇḍaka then told the 1,250 cowherds,

original: “tena hi, bhaṇe, ekamekaṁ dhenuṁ gahetvā ekamekassa bhikkhuno upatiṭṭhatha taruṇena khīrena bhojessāmā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhaṇe ekam ekam dhenum gahetvā ekam ekassa bhikkhunaḥ upatiṭṭhatha taruṇena khīrena bhojessāma ati
translated: “Please take one cow each and give fresh milk to each monk.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi, taruṇena ca khīrena.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi taruṇena ca khīrena
translated: Meṇḍaka then served and satisfied the Saṅgha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with his own hands with exquisite staple and non-staple food, including fresh milk.

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā khīraṁ na paṭiggaṇhanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā khīram na paṭiggaṇhanti

analyzed: paṭiggaṇhatha bhikkhave paribhuñjatha ati
translated: “Receive it, monks, and eat it.”

original: Atha kho meṇḍako gahapati buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena🔽sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā taruṇena ca khīrena bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho meṇḍakaḥ gahapati buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena  sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā taruṇena ca khīrena bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Meṇḍaka then served and satisfied the Saṅgha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with exquisite staple and non-staple food,🔽including fresh milk. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Meṇḍaka sat down to one side

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho meṇḍako gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu meṇḍakaḥ gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him,

analyzed: santi bhante maggāḥ kantārāḥ appa udakāḥ appa bhakkhāḥ na sukarāḥ apātheyyena gantu

analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnam pātheyyam anujānātu uti

original: Atha kho bhagavā meṇḍakaṁ gahapatiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā meṇḍakam gahapatim dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Then the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened Meṇḍaka with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi

original: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañca gorase—

translated: “Monks, I allow five products of a cow:

analyzed: santi bhikkhave maggā kantārāḥ appa udakāḥ appa bhakkhāḥ na sukarāḥ apātheyyena gantu
translated: There are roads through the wilderness that are short of water and food, and it’s not easy to travel them without provisions.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pātheyyaṁ pariyesituṁ taṇḍulo taṇḍulatthikena, muggo muggatthikena,
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave pātheyyam pariyesitum taṇḍulaḥ taṇḍula atthikena muggaḥ mugga atthikena

translated: There are faithful and confident people who deposit money with the providers of requisites, saying,

analyzed: iminā ayyassa yam kappiyam tam detha ati

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yaṁ tato kappiyaṁ taṁ sādituṁ;
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave yam tatas kappiyam tam sāditu
translated: I allow you to make use of whatever is suitable from that.

original: na tvevāhaṁ, bhikkhave, kenaci pariyāyena jātarūparajataṁ sāditabbaṁ pariyesitabbanti vadāmī”ti.
analyzed: na tu eva āha bhikkhave kenacid pariyāyena jātarūpa rajatam sāditabbam pariyesitabbanti vadāmi iti
translated: But I say that under no circumstances should you make use of or search for gold and silver.”

original: 23. Keṇiyajaṭilavatthu
analyzed: keṇiya jaṭila vatthu
translated: The account of the matted-hair ascetic Keṇiya

translated: Wandering on, the Buddha eventually arrived at Āpaṇa.

original: Assosi kho keṇiyo jaṭilo—🔽“samaṇo khalu bho gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito āpaṇaṁ anuppatto, taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato …pe…
analyzed: assosi kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ āpaṇam anuppatto tam kho pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ pe
translated: The matted-hair ascetic Keṇiya heard🔽that the Buddha had arrived.

translated: He thought, “It’s good that I get to see that Buddha, that perfected one, that fully awakened one. It’s been a long time since I’ve seen such a great ascetic.”

original: Atha kho keṇiyassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

analyzed: kim nu kho aham samaṇassa gotamassa harāpeyyanti
translated: “What can I offer him?”

original: Atha kho keṇiyassa jaṭilassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyassa jaṭilassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought,

analyzed: ye api kho te brāhmaṇānam pubbakāḥ isayaḥ mantānam kattāraḥ mantānam pavattāraḥ yesam idam
translated: “Those ancient brahmin seers, the creators of the hymns, the expounders of the hymns,

analyzed: aṭṭhakaḥ vāmakaḥ vāmadevaḥ vessāmittaḥ yamataggi aṅgīrasaḥ bhāradvājaḥ vāseṭṭhaḥ kassapaḥ bhagu rattūparatāḥ viratāḥ vikālabhojanāḥ te evarūpāni pānāni sādiyisu
translated: namely, Aṭṭhaka, Vāmaka, Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta, Yamataggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, and Bhagu—🔽they too drank alcohol.

analyzed: samaṇaḥ api gotamaḥ rattu uparataḥ virataḥ vikāla bhojanāḥ arahati samaṇaḥ api gotamaḥ evarūpāni pānāni sādiyitunti
translated: The ascetic Gotama refrains from drinking alcohol, so he too should drink alcohol.”

original: pahūtaṁ pānaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā kājehi gāhāpetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi;
analyzed: pahūtam pānam paṭiyādāpetvā kājehi gāhāpetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi

analyzed: tena hi keṇiya bhikkhūnam dehi iti

translated: Then Keṇiya personally served and satisfied the Sangha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with a variety of drinks. When the Buddha had washed his hand and had put away his bowl, he sat to one side.

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—

translated: “Even though the Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks, and I have confidence only in brahmins, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: “Mahā kho, keṇiya, bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni, tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno”ti.
analyzed: mahā kho keṇiya bhikkhu saṅghaḥ aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhu satāni tvam ca brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ ti
translated: “The Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks, and you have confidence only in brahmins.”
