translated: For a third time Keṇiya said,🔽“Even though the Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks, and I have confidence only in brahmins, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: “kiñcāpi kho, bho gotama, mahā bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhatelasāni bhikkhusatāni, ahañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno, adhivāsetu bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.

translated: “Even though there are so many monks in the community, and I have so much faith in brahmins, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the community of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.

translated: Keṇiya personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha. When the Buddha had finished his meal, Keṇiya sat down to one side

analyzed: rājā mukham manussāna
translated: The king as the chief of humans,

original: Atha kho bhagavā keṇiyaṁ jaṭilaṁ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā keṇiyam jaṭilam imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: After expressing his appreciation to Keṇiya with these verses, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: 24. Rojamallavatthu
analyzed: roja mallavatthu
translated: . The account of Rosika the Mallian

original: Atha kho bhagavā āpaṇe yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena kusinārā tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā āpaṇe yathābhirantam viharitvā yena kusinārā tena cārikam pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: When the Buddha had stayed at Āpaṇa for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Kusinārā with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

original: Assosuṁ kho kosinārakā mallā—“bhagavā kira kusināraṁ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehī”ti.
analyzed: assosum kho kosinārakāḥ mallā bhagavā kira kusināram āgacchati mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi iti
translated: The Mallas of Kusinārā heard that the Buddha was coming,

original: Te saṅgaraṁ akaṁsu—“yo bhagavato paccuggamanaṁ na karissati, pañcasatānissa daṇḍo”ti.
analyzed: te saṅgaram akasuyaḥ bhagavato paccuggamanam na karissati daṇḍaḥ iti
translated: and they made an agreement, saying, “Anyone who doesn’t go out to meet the Buddha will be fined five hundred coins.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena rojo mallo āyasmato ānandassa sahāyo hoti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena kusinārā tadavasari.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena rojaḥ mallaḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa sahāyaḥ hoti  atha kho bhagavā anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena kusinārā tat avasari
translated: At that time Rojo the Mallian was a friend of Venerable Ānanda.🔽Soon afterwards, as the Buddha continued wandering toward Kusinārā,

original: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā bhagavato paccuggamanaṁ akaṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho kosi nārakāḥ mallāḥ bhagavato paccuggamanam akasu
translated: the Mallas of Kusinārā came out to meet him.

original: Atha kho rojo mallo bhagavato paccuggamanaṁ karitvā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho rojaḥ mallaḥ bhagavato paccuggamanam karitvā yena āyasmai ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: Rojo the Mallian did the same, and he went to Ānanda, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhitaṁ kho rojaṁ mallaṁ āyasmā ānando etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam ṭhitam kho rojam mallam āyasmai ānandaḥ etat avoca
translated: Ānanda said to him,

original: “uḷāraṁ kho te idaṁ, āvuso roja, yaṁ tvaṁ bhagavato paccuggamanaṁ akāsī”ti.
analyzed: uḷāram kho te idam āvuso roja yam tvam bhagavato paccuggamanam akāsi iti
translated: “It’s wonderful, friend Rojo, that you’ve come out to meet the Buddha.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhante ānanda, bahukato buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā;
analyzed: na aha bhante ānanda bahu kataḥ buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā
translated: “I don’t have much confidence in the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha,

original: api ca ñātīhi saṅgaro kato—‘yo bhagavato paccuggamanaṁ na karissati, pañcasatānissa daṇḍo’ti;
analyzed: api ca ñātīhi saṅgaraḥ katoyaḥ bhagavato paccuggamanam na karissati daṇḍaḥ iti
translated: but my relatives have imposed a fine on me, saying that I have to pay five hundred coins if I don’t go out to meet the Buddha.

original: so kho ahaṁ, bhante ānanda, ñātīnaṁ daṇḍabhayā evāhaṁ bhagavato paccuggamanaṁ akāsin”ti.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhante ānanda ñātīnam daṇḍa bhayā eva aham bhagavato paccuggamanam akāsinti
translated: I didn’t come out to meet the Buddha because of the threat of punishment from my relatives.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando anattamano ahosi “kathañhi nāma rojo mallo evaṁ vakkhatī”ti?
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ anatta manaḥ ahosi katham hi nāma rojaḥ mallo evam vakkhati iti
translated: Ānanda was displeased and thought, “How can Roja say such a thing?”🔽He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and told him what had happened.

original: “ayaṁ, bhante, rojo mallo abhiññāto ñātamanusso.
analyzed: aya bhante rojaḥ mallaḥ abhiññātaḥ ñāta manusso
translated: “Sir, Roja Malla is well-known and famous.

original: Mahatthiko kho pana evarūpānaṁ ñātamanussānaṁ imasmiṁ dhammavinaye pasādo.
analyzed: mahatthikaḥ kho pana evarūpānam ñāta manussānam imasmin dhamma vinaye pasādaḥ
translated: It’s a great gain for this teaching and training when such well-known and famous people have confidence in it.

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā tathā karotu, yathā rojo mallo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye pasīdeyyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā tathā karotu yathā rojaḥ mallaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye pasīdeyya ati
translated: It would be good if you would do something to inspire confidence in Roja.”

original: “Na kho taṁ, ānanda, dukkaraṁ tathāgatena, yathā rojo mallo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye pasīdeyyā”ti.
analyzed: na kho te ānanda dukkaram tathāgatena yathā rojaḥ mallaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye pasīdeyya ati
translated: “Ānanda, it’s not difficult for me to inspire confidence in Roja.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā rojaṁ mallaṁ mettena cittena pharitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā rojam mallam mettena cittena pharitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram pāvisi
translated: Then, after suffusing Roja with a mind of loving-kindness, the Blessed One got up from his seat and went into his dwelling.

original: Atha kho rojo mallo bhagavato mettena cittena phuṭṭho, seyyathāpi nāma gāviṁ taruṇavaccho;
analyzed: atha kho rojaḥ mallaḥ bhagavataḥ mettena cittena phuṭṭhaḥ seyyathā api nāma gāvim taruṇa vacchaḥ
translated: Then Roja, suffused with the Blessed One’s mind of loving-kindness, was just like a young calf:

original: evameva vihārena vihāraṁ pariveṇena pariveṇaṁ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhū pucchati—
analyzed: evam eva vihārena vihāram pariveṇena pariveṇam upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhū pucchati
translated: he went from dwelling to dwelling, from courtyard to courtyard, asking the monks,

original: “kahaṁ nu kho, bhante, etarahi so bhagavā viharati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, dassanakāmā hi mayaṁ taṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
analyzed: kaham nu kho bhante etarahi saḥ bhagavā viharati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ dassana kāmāḥ hi mayam tam bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddhan ti
translated: “Venerable sirs, where is the Blessed One, worthy & rightly self-awakened, at present? We want to see the Blessed One, worthy & rightly self-awakened.”

original: “Esāvuso roja, vihāro saṁvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṁ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṁ ākoṭehi, vivarissati te bhagavā dvāran”ti.
analyzed: esa āvuso vihāraḥ savuta dvāro tena appasaddaḥ upasaṅkamitvā a taramānaḥ āḷindam pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷam ākoṭehi vivarissati te bhagavā dvāranti
translated: “Friend Roja, that dwelling has a closed door. Approach it without hurrying, without running. Having approached it silently, clear your throat. The Blessed One will open the door for you.”

original: Atha kho rojo mallo yena so vihāro saṁvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṁ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṁ ākoṭesi. Vivari bhagavā dvāraṁ.
analyzed: atha kho rojaḥ mallaḥ yena saḥ vihāraḥ savuta dvāro tena appasaddaḥ upasaṅkamitvā a taramānaḥ āḷindam pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷam ākoṭesi bhagavā dvāra
translated: He then approached the dwelling, which was closed. He coughed, knocked the latch, and entered.

original: Atha kho rojo mallo vihāraṁ pavisitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinnassa kho rojassa mallassa bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: atha khalu rojaḥ mallaḥ vihāram pavisitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnassa kho rojassa mallassa bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: He bowed to the Buddha and sat down,

original: dānakathaṁ …pe…
analyzed: dāna katham pe
translated: and the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

original: aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: apara ppaccayaḥ satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then said to the Buddha,

original: “sādhu, bhante, ayyā mamaññeva paṭiggaṇheyyuṁ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ, no aññesan”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante ayyāḥ mamaññā iva paṭiggaṇheyyum cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra no
translated: “Sir, may the masters accept from me a robe, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies for the sick.”

original: “Yesaṁ kho, roja, sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammo diṭṭho seyyathāpi tayā, tesampi evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: yesam kho roja sekkhena ñāṇena sekkhena dassanena dhammo diṭṭho seyyathā api tayā tesam pi evam hoti
translated: “Rojo, those who have seen the Dhamma,

original: ‘aho nūna ayyā amhākaññeva paṭiggaṇheyyuṁ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ, no aññesan’ti.
analyzed: aho nūna ayyāḥ amhākañca iva paṭiggaṇheyyum cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhāra no aññesanti
translated: ‘Oh, if only the Venerable Ānanda would accept robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies from us, and not from others.’

original: Tena hi, roja, tava ceva paṭiggahissanti aññesañcā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi roja tava ca iva paṭiggahissanti aññesam ca ati
translated: Well then, Roja, he will accept from you and from others.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena kusinārāyaṁ paṇītānaṁ bhattānaṁ bhattapaṭipāṭi aṭṭhitā hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kusinārāyam paṇītānam bhattānam bhatta paṭipāṭi aṭṭhitā hoti
translated: At that time in Kusinārā a succession of fine meals had been arranged.

original: Atha kho rojassa mallassa paṭipāṭiṁ alabhantassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho rojassa mallassa paṭipāṭim a labhantassa etat ahosi
translated: But Roja, not getting a turn, thought,

original: “yannūnāhaṁ bhattaggaṁ olokeyyaṁ, yaṁ bhattagge nāssa, taṁ paṭiyādeyyan”ti.🔽Atha kho rojo mallo bhattaggaṁ olokento dve nāddasa—
analyzed: yat nūna aham bhattaggam olokeyya yam bhattagge na assa tam paṭiyādeyyanti  atha kho rojaḥ mallaḥ bhattaggam olokentaḥ dve na āddasa
translated: “Why don’t I look at the kitchen and prepare whatever is missing?”

original: ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca.
analyzed: ḍākam ca piṭṭha khādanīyañca
translated: Looking at the kitchen, he saw that there was no meat and rice.

original: Atha kho rojo mallo yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu rojaḥ mallaḥ yena āyasmai ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: He then went to Ānanda and said,

original: “idha me, bhante ānanda, paṭipāṭiṁ alabhantassa etadahosi—
analyzed: idha me bhante ānanda paṭipāṭim a labhantassa etat ahosi
translated: “Sir, since I didn’t get a turn, I thought,

original: ‘yannūnāhaṁ bhattaggaṁ olokeyyaṁ, yaṁ bhattagge nāssa, taṁ paṭiyādeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham bhattaggam olokeyya yam bhattagge na assa tam paṭiyādeyyanti
translated: ‘I’ll look at the kitchen to see if there’s anything I can prepare.’

original: So kho ahaṁ, bhante ānanda, bhattaggaṁ olokento dve nāddasaṁ—
analyzed: saḥ kho aha bhante ānanda bhattaggam olokentaḥ dve na āddasa
translated: When I looked, I didn’t see two things:

original: ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca.
analyzed: ḍākam ca piṭṭha khādanīyañca
translated: meat and flour.

original: Sacāhaṁ, bhante ānanda, paṭiyādeyyaṁ ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca, paṭiggaṇheyya me bhagavā”ti?
analyzed: sacā āha bhante ānanda paṭiyādeyyam ḍākam ca piṭṭha khādanīyañca paṭiggaṇheyya me bhagavā iti
translated: If I were to prepare them, would the Buddha accept them?”

original: “Tena hi, roja, bhagavantaṁ paṭipucchissāmī”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: tena hi roja bhagavantam paṭipucchissāmi iti  atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesi
translated: “Well then, I’ll ask him.”🔽He then told the Buddha, who said,

original: “Tena hānanda, paṭiyādetū”ti.
analyzed: tena ha ānanda paṭiyādetu uti
translated: “Well then, Ānanda, prepare them.”

original: “Tena hi, roja, paṭiyādehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi roja paṭiyādehi iti
translated: “Well then, Roja, prepare them.”

original: Atha kho rojo mallo tassā rattiyā accayena pahūtaṁ ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato upanāmesi—
analyzed: atha kho rojaḥ mallo tassā rattiyāḥ accayena pahūtam ḍākam ca piṭṭhakhādanīyañca paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavataḥ upanāmesi
translated: The following morning Roja had much meat and flour prepared and brought it to the Buddha,

original: “paṭiggaṇhātu me, bhante, bhagavā ḍākañca piṭṭhakhādanīyañcā”ti.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhātu me bhante bhagavā ḍākañca piṭṭha khādanīyañca ati
translated: “Sir, please accept the meat and flour.”

original: “Tena hi, roja, bhikkhūnaṁ dehī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi roja bhikkhūnam dehi iti
translated: “Well then, Roja, give it to the monks.”

original: Atha kho rojo mallo bhikkhūnaṁ deti.
analyzed: atha kho rojaḥ mallaḥ bhikkhūnam deti
translated: Roja then gave it to the monks,

original: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti
translated: The monks hesitated, thinking, “Is it allowable to receive and eat raw grain?”

original: “Paṭiggaṇhatha, bhikkhave, paribhuñjathā”ti.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhatha bhikkhave paribhuñjatha ati
translated: “Monks, I allow you to receive and eat raw grain.”

original: Atha kho rojo mallo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pahūtehi ḍākehi ca piṭṭhakhādanīyehi🔽ca sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantaṁ dhotahatthaṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho rojaḥ mallaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham pahūtehi ḍākehi ca piṭṭha khādanīyehi  ca sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantam dhotahattham onīta patta pāṇim ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then Roja personally served and satisfied the Sangha of monks, with the Buddha at its head, with various fresh and tasty foods.🔽When the Buddha had finished his meal, Roja sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho rojaṁ mallaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho rojam mallam bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

original: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbañca ḍākaṁ sabbañca piṭṭhakhādanīyan”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave sabbañca ḍākam sabbañca piṭṭhakhādanīyanti
translated: “Monks, I allow all kinds of raw grain and all kinds of flour.”

original: 25. Vuḍḍhapabbajitavatthu
analyzed: vuḍḍha pabbajita vatthu
translated: The case of the one who went forth when old

original: Atha kho bhagavā kusinārāyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena ātumā tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā kusinārāyam yathābhirantam viharitvā yena ātumā tena cārikam pakkāmi mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: After staying at Kusinārā for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Ātumā with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro vuḍḍhapabbajito ātumāyaṁ paṭivasati nahāpitapubbo.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ vuḍḍha pabbajitaḥ ātumāyam paṭivasati nahāpita pubbaḥ
translated: At that time there was an elderly monk staying at Ātumā who had gone forth when he was old. He was a former barber,

original: Tassa dve dārakā honti, mañjukā paṭibhāneyyakā, dakkhā pariyodātasippā sake ācariyake nahāpitakamme.
analyzed: tassa dve dārakā honti mañjukā paṭibhāneyyakā dakkhā pariyodāta sippā sake ācariyake nahāpita kamme
translated: and he had two young sons, who were gentle, courteous, and skilled in their father’s work.

original: Assosi kho so vuḍḍhapabbajito—“bhagavā kira ātumaṁ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehī”ti.
analyzed: assosi kho so vuḍḍha pabbajitaḥ bhagavā kira ātumam āgacchati mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi iti
translated: When he heard that the Buddha was coming,

original: Atha kho so vuḍḍhapabbajito te dārake etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ vuḍḍhapabbajitaḥ te dārake etat avoca
translated: he said to his sons,

original: “bhagavā kira, tātā, ātumaṁ āgacchati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: bhagavā kira tātā ātumam āgacchati mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhatelasehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: “The Buddha is coming to Ātumā with a large sangha of twelve-hundred and fifty monks.

original: Gacchatha tumhe, tātā, khurabhaṇḍaṁ ādāya nāḷiyāvāpakena anugharakaṁ anugharakaṁ
analyzed: gacchatha tumhe tātā khura bhaṇḍam ādāya nāḷiyā vāpakena anugharakam anugharaka
translated: Go and shave the monks’ heads, one after the other,

original: āhiṇḍatha, loṇampi, telampi, taṇḍulampi, khādanīyampi saṁharatha, bhagavato āgatassa
analyzed: āhiṇḍatha loṇam pi telam pi taṇḍulam pi khādanīyam pi saharatha bhagavataḥ āgatassa
translated: “Go and collect salt, oil, rice, and fresh food. When the Fortunate One arrives

original: yāgupānaṁ karissāmā”ti.
analyzed: yāgu pānam karissāma ati
